title: My Year in Data: a Visual Reflection on 2019
description: I tracked my activities for a year. Then I visualized them. Here’s what I learned.

title: Here’s What I Learned From 30 Days of Creative Coding (a Codevember Retrospective)
description: Go easy on yourself. Try something new. Learn in public.

title: How to build a simple time series dashboard in Python with Panel, Altair and a Jupyter Notebook
description: Two filters + one interactive area chart in roughly 25 lines of code.

title: A new UX method for building better data visualization products
description: You’ve heard of user personas, and maybe even Jobs to Be Done. But what about QTBA? No? Good. I made it up.

title: Why visual literacy is essential to good data visualization
description: We know data literacy matters. But visual literacy matters too. Here’s why.

title: How to make a gif map using Python, Geopandas and Matplotlib
description: No need for Photoshop: make an animated chart using only Python and the command line.

title: Let’s make a map! Using Geopandas, Pandas and Matplotlib to make a Choropleth map
description: A beginner-friendly tutorial on how to get started using Geopandas to create shaded choropleth maps.

title: Data Curious 2017 Year in Review: My favourite data stories, datasets and visualisations from last year
description: Some of the very best pieces of visual and data journalism from 2017, as featured in past editions of my newsletter Data Curious.

title: Here’s what I learned from writing, coding and designing my own longform data-driven feature story
description: A reflection on what I learned while creating my MA dissertation.

title: How Twitter responded an hour after the Westminster attack
description: A network analysis and clustering visualization of Twitter activity following the 2017 Westminster terrorist attack.
